intro: Gaultheria elassantha, commonly known as the slender wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and evergreens adapted to acidic soils. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. Gaultheria elassantha is also valued for its medicinal properties, particularly due to the presence of methyl salicylate in its leaves.
